title: Which Senators Broke Ranks With Democrats to Advance the GOP Plan to End the Government Shutdown?
summary: Two of them are retiring, and none of the others face re-election in 2026.

title: Age Is the Issue That Democrats Can’t Shut Down
summary: A restless Democratic base is seething at older leaders in Washington.

title: Jeanne Shaheen Faces Shutdown Blowback From Her Daughter
summary: Senator Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire voted to move to end the shutdown. But her daughter Stefany Shaheen, a congressional candidate in their state, sharply criticized the deal.

title: Trump Tries to Seize ‘Affordability’ as Americans’ Economic Worries Grow
summary: The issue has buoyed Democrats and is resonating with an American electorate that is souring on the president’s economic agenda.

title: How Syria’s President Transformed His Image
summary: Syrian President Ahmed al-Shara’s meeting with President Trump in Washington signifies a new turn for al-Shara, a former Islamist rebel leader who was once designated by the United States as a terrorist with a $10 million bounty on his head. Our reporter Christina Goldbaum describes the meeting.

title: Syria’s President Meets Trump at White House for First Time
summary: The visit by President Ahmed al-Shara is another step in the transformation of the former rebel leader once wanted by the United States as a terrorist.

title: With SNAP on Hold, Low-Income Shoppers Cut Back and Businesses Worry
summary: A delay in SNAP benefits mixed with a decline in foot traffic has many stores, restaurants and food producers concerned about sales.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Major Challenge to Mail-In Ballot Laws
summary: The justices agreed to hear a challenge to Mississippi’s law, a case that could upend similar measures in dozens of states before the 2026 election.

title: Supreme Court Denies Request to Revisit Same-Sex Marriage Decision
summary: Kim Davis, a Kentucky county clerk who refused to issue same-sex marriage licenses, had asked the court to reconsider its landmark 2015 opinion.

title: Marriage Ruling Relieves Gay Americans and Leaves Conservatives Pledging New Challenges
summary: The Supreme Court chose not to revisit a case involving same-sex marriage. The number of married same-sex couples has doubled in the last 10 years.

title: Prison Guards Shaved His Dreadlocks. The Supreme Court Seems Skeptical He Can Sue.
summary: Lower courts condemned the treatment of Damon Landor, a Rastafarian, but found that a federal law protecting religious rights barred him from suing prison officials for money.

title: Why the BBC Is Facing Its Gravest Crisis in Decades
summary: The British public service broadcaster apologized on Monday for a misleadingly edited documentary about President Trump. But the scandal had already claimed two of its top executives.

title: Trump Threatens to Sue the BBC for $1 Billion After Jan. 6 Documentary
summary: A lawyer for President Trump said the BBC’s editing of a speech he gave was “defamatory.” The broadcaster apologized on Monday for an “error in judgment.”

title: 2025 Booker Prize Goes to David Szalay’s ‘Flesh’
summary: The rags-to-riches tale had already made fans of Zadie Smith and Dua Lipa. Roddy Doyle, who chaired the judging panel, called the book “singular” and “extraordinary.”

title: M.L.B. Limits Bets on Individual Pitches After Gambling Charges
summary: Two Cleveland pitchers were accused of colluding with bettors. The league and its gambling company partners have put a $200 limit on wagers on individual pitches.

title: Microbets, Parlays and Prop Bets: A Guide to the M.L.B. Gambling Scandal
summary: Federal prosecutors say two pitchers for the Cleveland Guardians tipped off bettors about what pitches they would throw, setting up rigged “microbets.” M.L.B. moved to limit such bets.

title: At COP30 in Belém, Brazil, Chinese Technology Is Shifting Climate Politics
summary: At this year’s climate summit, the United States is out and Europe is struggling. But emerging countries are embracing renewable energy thanks to a glut of cheap equipment.

title: F.D.A. Will Remove Black Box Warnings From Hormone Treatments for Menopause
summary: The benefits of hormone replacement have been underappreciated, Dr. Marty Makary, the agency’s commissioner, said on Monday. Critics described evidence for the change as insufficient.

title: Chi Ossé Plans to Challenge Jeffries, Despite Mamdani’s Opposition
summary: Chi Ossé, a New York City councilman, has told allies he is preparing to challenge Representative Hakeem Jeffries, the Democratic leader of the House.

title: Mamdani Fills 2 Top Posts With Government Veteran and Trusted Aide
summary: The mayor-elect named Dean Fuleihan, a government veteran, to be his first deputy mayor. Elle Bisgaard-Church will serve as his chief of staff.

title: A MAGA Senator Promised Hope for a Dying Ohio Mill. Then Reality Set In.
summary: The town’s unionized workers wanted to believe that there was something better than what private equity owners had offered.

title: Families of Children Killed in Texas Floods Sue Camp Mystic, Claiming Gross Negligence
summary: Parents of campers and counselors who died in the July 4 Texas floods said the camp leadership did little before mounting “a hopeless ‘rescue’ effort from its self-created disaster.”

title: The 20-Somethings Who Raised $121 Million to Build Military Drones
summary: Neros, a company founded in 2023 by former teenage drone racers, won a coveted Army contract and is gaining popularity in the defense sector.

title: The Post-Cold War Era Is Over. What Should We Call This New One?
summary: We have arrived at a “Polycene” moment where binary systems are giving way to multiple interconnected ones.

title: What Were Democrats Thinking?
summary: This is how the shutdown ends?

title: Congress Moves Closer to Ending the Shutdown
summary: Also, the Supreme Court declined to hear a challenge to same-sex marriage. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Jonathan Braun, Felon Freed by Trump, to Be Sentenced Again in Brooklyn
summary: A Brooklyn federal judge found that Jonathan Braun had violated the rules of his release by assaulting a nanny, swinging an IV pole at a nurse and dodging tolls in luxury cars.

title: Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Farewell: ‘I’m Going Quiet’
summary: In one of his final missives as the company’s leader, Mr. Buffett said he would accelerate his plans to disburse his fortune to his children’s foundations.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Could Trim Prison Sentence With Drug Rehab Program
summary: A spokesman for the fallen music mogul, who is serving a four-year sentence for prostitution-related offenses at the Fort Dix prison complex in New Jersey, said he has been accepted to the program.

title: Canada Lost Its Measles Elimination Status. What Does It Mean for the U.S.?
summary: The disease was once considered eliminated in Canada, but not any more — there have been more than 5,000 cases in the last 12 months as vaccination rates have fallen.
